column5:
Merge pull request #744 from cedricvidal/master

upgraded grunt-umd to 3.0.0 in order to fix CommonJS false positive detection
upgraded grunt-umd to 3.0.0 in order to fix CommonJS false positive environment detection issue in browser where a variable named exports exists

Merge pull request #724 from CharleysTante/master

add composer.json file

Merge pull request #710 from weshooper/patch-1

Unit of measurement is redundant in CSS

Unit of measurement is redundant in CSS

PhpStorm picked this up while inspecting our codebase.
Add a text link to the GitHub project
Added the geo property to the scroll event to help use cases like #631
Update doc on the scroll event + footer link
undocument 'whole', which is not easily actionable
use closing animation upon self destruction
made the destroy method synchronous. Renamed the 'core' file to 'main' for disambiguation
stop repositioning upon the opening of virtual keyboards
stop repositioning upon the opening of virtual keyboards
removed unnecessary file from the dist folder
added @campbeln 's Angular directive in the custom use cases
add the origin to the helper of functionAfter
deprecated encoded html in the title attribute, hinted at tooltipster-htmlTitle
Documented the destroy and destroyed event
add contentCloning to the HTML example
Made sideTip unpluggable. More JSDoc friendly source code
Make tooltips easily scrollable if their size is constrained
resolved conflicts between plugin options of the same name
Added the viewportAware option and the positionTest events
Dissociated touch and mouse events for maximum modularity. Added the detection of swiping. Documented more
simplified a little by using a clone during positioning tests
if there is no svg title either
Improved the support of SVG and move it to a plugin
Made UMD compliant. Renamed sideTip's css properties and renamed files according to its namespace. Cleaned up the parent scope.
removed the deprecated version property in bower.json
fixed a typo in the gruntfile and renumber v 4.0.0 for bower
moved the license to a separate files
removed the obsolete jQuery manifest file
forgot to remove sideTip from the core file
remove indexed gz files in git repo
Restructured the folders to accomodate plugins and added a grunt file
Improved the support of off screen origins
moved the sizing functions to a separate class for clarity and to make them usable on a clone (later)
Fixed rectangular map area tooltips. Added polygon and rectangular shapes to the demo file.
Fixed an overflow issue with visibility:hidden elements in Chrome. Happened when the tooltip content overflowed the document.
Removed the state method in favor of the new status method. Added the selfDestruction option and 'instance destroyed' warnings.
Suppressed errors coming from public method calls on a destroyed instance
Changed the way to call static methods (renamed to 'global' methods), added a global event emitter
added the close event, renamed a couple events
SVG support, improved delay and speed options, and more
forgot to proxy the public close method, oops

Merge pull request #474 from Justineo/v4

Better inline element support
better positioning for inline elements with at least 3 lines
Added the sizeTracker and trackerInterval options
fixed the start animation random failure
Changed callback signatures and fixed scrollable areas
Added events and open/close triggers. Removed onlyOne, autoClose, hideOnClick and positionTrackerCallback options.
Revised how to get ahold of instances

Merge pull request #464 from nickcannariato/master

Added MIT license in accordance with the README
Added MIT license in accordance with the README
reintroduced the support of image maps into v4
Added full support for fixed position origins
Added the functionFormat option, removed the stopPropagation commands and optimised DOM checks
Removed the arrow by default in the default display plugin in IE6
Introduced the fixedLineage variable for positioning
merge commit; send unwrapped html element to positionTracker callback
Rename closeOnClick to hideOnClick for names consistency
Corrected the fixed width example in doc

Merge pull request #195 from arthurpf/master

Missing semicolon in minified version
give the option method a setter capability
Logging a warning instead of throwing an error when initiating a non-multiple tooltip on an element that already has one
refactored all callback options for consistency, simplicity and advanced use cases linked to the multiple option. Added the elementOrigin method
Adapted the onlyOne option to work fine with the multiple option
Made public methods real methods of the instance object for the future 'multiple' option. Renamed a few methods for readability. Namespaced private methods with an underscore.
fixed vertical positioning on area targets
load resources on the same protocol in doc & demo files
Detach content before removing the tooltip, to preserve potential handlers from jQuery's remove()'s deletion, for later use
Edited the show/hide callback parameter explanation
Fixed the functionBefore and functionAfter which were called with parameter  instead of . Also, they are now called in the context of
Added a callback parameter to show and hide API methods
Fix the content getter method when content is null
Bug fix in the repositioning of the arrow
Stopped hiding tooltips at window orientation change. It may break scenarios involving interactive and/or non-autoclosing tooltips.
check that the tooltip is in the DOM at repositioning, in case the positiong method is call after the tooltip has been manually removed from DOM, but before the checkInterval collected the garbage
Removed height 100% that caused the body not to occupy the full window, thus making Tooltipster look broken with trigger click

Merge pull request #112 from PaulAnnekov/fix-offset

Fix bug with wrong tooltip offset

Merge pull request #108 from wastaz/master

Fixed tooltips not showing in browsers not supporting css animations
Updated the doc concerning themes and made proper inclusions from the project theme files.

Merge pull request #98 from iamceege/dev

Upgrade version 3.0
Added in Louis to footer and updated logo to 3.0
Put doc on master branch, update Readme
Not interpreting HTML in strings at destroy call
Brought back the touchDevices option, but only for pure-touch device (not hybrid ones), otherwise it's too complex
Improved behavior of click/hover triggers on touch devices. Removed the toucheDevice option which cannot be handled correctly without a proper library for touch events...
Prevent onlyOne from closing non-autoclosing tooltips. Moved demo file in seperate folder and updated secondary files.

Used the instance namespace for all bindings. Made autoClose consistent between click and hover triggers. AutoClose set to false will now apply for hover triggers as soon as the tooltip is shown. Now respecting the interactive tolerance when the mouse leaves an auto-closing interactive tooltip.
Changed the 'click' trigger behavior : when a tooltip is open, any click on the body will close it (except for the interactive and autoClose options).
Removed the dot from the theme and iconTheme options

Made the animation process simpler and easier to track with a status property. Used a queue only for css animations. Got rid of the delay on API call on the show method (kept in our click and hover triggers only).
Title attributes are now treated as strings as they should be, not HTML
Quick fix for timeouts that fired on possibly already removed elements. But animations will need to be refactored at some point
Modified the exception throws for easier debugging
Enforced the contentCloning option to the update method too
Also allowed to prevent cloning icons with an iconCloning option + updated comments
Stripped units in positionInfo() for consistency
Removed unnecessary line, already done in positionTooltip()
Added an option to use directly the provided content object instead of a clone
Listed the elProxyPosition under the wrong name

Merge pull request #80 from iamceege/positionDynamic

Added positionTracker option to the dev branch, to allow an open tooltip follow its element if it moves.
positionTracker : will also take the element size changes into account
Renamed option to 'positionTracker'. Optimized it for fixed position elements
PositionDynamic : tooltip had rather follow the elProxy. Will need to be changed someday, when tooltipster is in charge of the icon positioning too
Fixed the reappearance of dying tooltips when using javascript animation
Stopped applying the bindings that already existed when showing an already opened tooltip. + code cleaning
Hide tooltip before disabling it, in case of interactiveAutoClose false
Fixed the way tooltip close because of touch events. Tooltips used to collide with each other and never close in some cases.

Stopped relying on mouse events to handle touch events. Other scripts or the browser itself can simulate mouse events anyway, it is not reliable. Besides, using the mouse does not mean we should not listen for touch gestures anyway. Example : a tooltip is shown on mouseenter, but should be hidden if the screen is touched somewhere else afterwards.

Merge pull request #76 from louisameline/dev

Deleted extra indent that somehow got doubled up during the merge
Deleted extra indent that somehow got doubled up during the merge

Merge pull request #75 from louisameline/dev

Merge Tooltipster refactoring into dev branch

Merge pull request #74 from louisameline/master

Fixed functionInit, changed version to 2.2.3
Fixed functionInit and broken minified version, changed version to 2.2.3 (last before the refactored version)
Updated version number + removed ghost parameter in plugin encapsulation function
Updated MIT license statement with url

Stopped wrapping and styling the icon if it was already provided in the form of an html object. Now cloning content and icon when it is provided in the form of objects, as a same object can be set as parameter of several instances and should not be shared between them
Now more strict with the definition of content : an empty string is actually valid content, while only null is the absence of content

Stopped reinitializing the checkInterval at each update when the tooltip is open, as it is no longer necessary since this interval is no longer in charge of updating the content. Also forgot to set the interval back at 200ms after testing, oops. Done.
Fixed the queues when delay = 0 : the jQuery .delay function should not be called at all so things can happen synchronously
Throw an exception when an unknown public method is used, rather than failing silently and returning 'this'. Will help debug typos.
Fixed the updateTooltip method to be used when the tooltip is not open
Merged the 'content' and 'update' methods. 'update' is still working for retrocompatibility but is deprecated.

Renamed the 'val' method to 'content', it seems more appropriate since the result can now be jquery objects and not only strings, if that is that's what was provided as content in the first place. Also sorted methods by alphabetical order.

Merge pull request #71 from louisameline/destroyFix

Remove the delegated icon in destroy method
Reverting index back to development version of Tooltipster
Adding in icon fix and rewriting functionInit for the best of both worlds
In showTooltip, find and hide the opened tooltips using the new tooltipstered class and the regular public method

The default value for the onlyOne option is now false. A tooltip initialized with this value to true currently closes tooltips even if they have been set to interactive and not autoclosable. As the plugin is getting more robust and ready for heavy interactions, this behavior is questionable and should at least be disabled by default. Most people will not see the difference anyway since tooltips are closed quickly by default.
Reviewed some comments that needed to be changed + a couple details
Fixed the window events which did not work if the plugin name was different from tooltipster
Added an exception to warn when a method is called on an unitialized element
Forgot to bypass the .data method for window events

Removed the lines that made changes in a select input close the tooltip if interactiveAutoClose is true. The plugin should not dictate an arbitrary behavior of some content of the tooltip, users should instead bind their content as they wish to the desired public methods.
Added the tooltipstered class to put the window events back in order

Fixed the way content is provided to the plugin to accept content in any form, especially an object with bindings etc. It is not tooltipster's job to filter stuff in the content and try to prevent XSS: people should not allow everything in their title attribute in the first place. Besides, the existing getContent function caused issues and not working adequately either
Bind on orientationchange anyway, it cannot hurt and touchDevice is not accurate anyway
Changed the order of things in the library : things which are basically bindings on the window all go to the end
Removed the weird, unexpected, slow and almost undocumented feature that allowed to interact with the tooltips inside a container
Unbind only the right functions for touch devices. Tooltips could previously collide with each other or even with the rest of the page before I namespaced

Removed all .data calls except the attachment of the plugin to the original element, replaced by instance variables. Removed confusing  variable names and used the self name convention. Removed useless var repetitions. Removed the awkward getContent function (to be replaced later).
Fixed unbinding on body to unbind only the plugin handlers

The update method is now immediate. Had to isolate the update process from the check interval. The tooltip will not react anymore to a content change made without calling the update method, at least for now.
Moved setDefaults into a static function again
Fixed FireFox select in tooltip bug, fixed some hint errors, and added interactiveAutoClose option
Reviewing and implementing script tag strip
Merge branch 'fix-xss' of github.com:PaulAnnekov/tooltipster into PaulAnnekov-fix-xss
Declaring var myLeftMirror to fix strict minification
On scroll, any opened tooltip will reposition as to make sure fixed origins don't have their tooltips float away
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:DelPoint/tooltipster into DelPoint-master

Merge pull request #65 from evangun/valFix

Fixed val method to consider only first matched element
Fixing various bugs and confirming fix for select elements inside tooltips
Fixing closing tooltip when interacting with a select inside
overflow-x on the body is now reset to what it was after tooltip closes
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:ajreiner/tooltipster into ajreiner-master
Fixing merge conflict and tweaking a few things
Returning demo tooltipster implementation back to basic
Moved the instantiation out of the if statement so when setDefaults() is called the plugin can instantiate at the same time
Merge branch 'setDefaults' of github.com:evangun/tooltipster into evangun-setDefaults

Merge pull request #63 from evangun/functionInit

Added functionInit() for a custom callback to be fired on initial instantiation
fixed issue where horizontal scrollbar was not reappearing when tooltip is hidden/destroyed

on scroll reposition

on scroll reposition - otherwise position:fixed element's tooltips will 'scroll-away'

Revert "Prevent <script> tags execution on show"

This reverts commit 10a825447e79f6ae7837db89af90d4b97d5c4d60.
Fix bug with wrong tooltip offset

Revert "Fix bug with wrong tooltip offset"

This reverts commit a2a066c599c426a8f593b1d66b69ad5d7274960b.
Fix bug with wrong tooltip offset

Revert "Get content from 'title' on 'update' call"

This reverts commit 578265cbaa32dfd2b2c2739bde15689fb1bb1542.

Revert "Fix bug with wrong tooltip offset"

This reverts commit c7a7b9d8410a2333e921e6b0e8679210e8112b23.
Fix bug with wrong tooltip offset

Merge pull request #43 from nirgeier/Unbind_touch_event_bug_fix

Bug fixed: Unbind touch event when destroying the tooltip

Merge pull request #42 from VlooMan/master

Adding Math.round to all inline CSS styles values

Merge pull request #36 from gocom/bower

Distribution via Bower package manager
Bug fixed: Unbind touch event when destroying the tooltip

Adding Math.round to all inline CSS styles values

Add Math.round() to all inline CSS styles values which are in pixels.
The CSS transition in Web-kit browsers makes the little arrow move if
the the inline CSS widths and positions are not integers.

Add bower.json.

Meta file for Bower package manager.
Changed licensing to MIT, smarter detection between non-touch/touch devices, content option can now accept jQuery objects, content update method now works on icons
Adding more flexibility to the customization of the animation played during content change
Refining and testing disable/enable API methods

Added option updateAnimation: boolean

When content is updated in an open tooltip, decide if there should be a
slight animation that plays
Fixing tooltip reposition bug on window resize
Tooltips will now be removed if its origin is removed
Need to fix origin detection removal

expanding API calls to support container selectors

Select containers to interact with the API of all tooltip origins
inside: $('body').tooltipster('show');

There is currently a bug with updating content in this manner. Work in
progress.
if a tooltip is open and its origin is removed, the tooltip will hide as well

added new API method to reposition tooltips

$(...).tooltipster('reposition')

This will make sure selected tooltips are correctly positioned. This
has now been attached to the window resize event under the Tooltipster
namespace. Open tooltips will now reposition themselves on window size
change.

better name spacing and interaction with API - thanks to glebtv

Better API allowing:
$(...).tooltipster('show')
$(...).tooltipster('hide')
$(...).tooltipster('destroy')
$(...).tooltipster('update', 'new text')

Namespace mouseenter, mouseleave, and click events to allow destroying
tooltip without affecting user's other events
arrow: false position bug fix - thanks to glebtv

Merge pull request #11 from glebtv/patch-1

Tooltip without arrow is not positioned - fixed

Update js/jquery.tooltipster.js

Position tooltip even without arrow
fixing a bug with the 'content' option
refinining how tooltip content is updated when tooltip is showing
further refinements to updating tooltip content while tooltip is still open
added refinements for updating tooltip content when tooltip is visible
offsetY and offsetX are now parsed as integers to protect against accidentally using a string

functionality to change tooltip content while the tooltip is currently open

Running $(element).data('tooltipsterContent', myNewContent) will now
update the content of an open tooltip. The variable 'element' in this
case does not equal the tooltip itself - but the element that the
tooltip originated from.
refining logic that will make sure tooltips don't go off the top of your screen and testing Masonry with Tooltipster
tooltips will now close on device orientation change
added support for any and all <area> tags inside of <maps>
adding a jQuery plugin manifest to add Tooltipster to the official plugin database
quick FireFox bug fix - some tooltips were causing the last word to jump to a new line

finalized release of Tooltipster 2.0 is here!

Changes:
- More object oriented code
- Simplified structure of CSS and themes
- Using CSS for animations/transitions when possible
- Interaction with tooltips now possible
- Custom show/hide triggers
- No more bubbling
- Custom callback functions allowing for things like AJAX populated
content in tooltips
- Detect and disable touch devices if desired
- Better touch device interaction

Deprecated:
- followMouse
- overrideText (renamed to 'content')
adding functionality that will automatically add a matching border around the arrow
renamed a few options to more logical names, corrected some styles affecting the arrow alignment, and removed title attrs replaced by a data attr on init instead of every show
beginning development of v2.0 - tons of improvements on the way
awesome smoke theme created by Kevin Trass
updated minified version of tooltipster js
fixed parent/child tooltip bug and added more logic to keep tooltips from going off the screen
adding base files to start dev work
Organized file structure and added new themes
Added first version of Tooltipster JS and CSS
